content.label:
You get a lot when you pay the small fee. Plus competition with others for each hand.

I believe in buying products I use and this game has fun variations. There are rules I wish weren’t there but every card game has them so accept them and move on. Part luck part skill. Win some lose some. 

Some rules are strange, but it’s the way it is designed so I’ve learned to live with the quirks. 

ONE QUESTION FOR PROGRAMMER:  often, too often it seems, I get the same rank card when turning over a pile (3 kings last round). I know you will say “It’s Random” but is your random generator really doing its job? As a long term programmer myself I know randomness and when it doesn’t seem right. You don’t need to answer this inquiry but please DOUBLE CHECK YOUR ALGORITHM. 

Thank you. I love the game.
What are the odds the almost every time you discard the same card comes up. On this game it’s about 90% of the time. Especially when the decks almost gone

Love the game, fun time-waster, in my opinion.  However,  I smell some rigging of the deck.  You shouldn’t be getting the same exact value card every time you trash a card. Everytime.  Literally, almost ever time. I get the first 3-4 decks done, and I run out of hands...  I trash a card.  Let’s say a 3.  What’s the card I get? Another 3.  Literally. Almost. Every. Time.  Please Explain.

title.label: I really want to like this app

content.label: I really want to like this app but I play a few games and I get a full screen ad (with music even though I have the app set to silent) PLUS I can’t navigate away from the full screen ad.    I have to from memory and restart.
The volume controller does not work for ads so your are forced to turn down the global volume instead or listen to loud annoying ads. This is just stupid.
Way too many ads, can’t close or anything. Too bad, used to be fun. Deleted.
Completely obnoxious ads, makes game unplayable.

this game took over my screen time for about 3 weeks. the idea is great, the graphics and sounds are great, even most of the game mechanics are good. but there are a few things that keep popping up that ultimately chipped away any interest or excitement i had for this game. 

mechanically, two pair IS a poker hand but not allowed, however, a 3-card straight is not a poker hand and is allowed. also, not being able to make a hand from the same row is annoying. it might not be if there were more than three rows OR if there were the same amount of cards in each pile. the final mechanic that really twists the knife is trashing a card and finding the same ranked card underneath. the probability of drawing a pair in a 52 card deck is something like 1/200. this happens every single game, often more than once. 

the scoring, on another hand, is totally bunk. not too bad in single deck, but vegas is just horrible. not only can you only score on one suit (bonus suit) but the point values too low to make your ante back and clearing the board is required to make anything above ante. also, why bother upping the ante? betting 50 and clearing the board with $20 wins you about 50. betting 200 and clearing the board with $20 wins you about 50 (maybe slightly more). the risk is SO much higher but the reward is the same. 

then there are exhaustive ads that increase over time. 

was fun for a bit, but i’m over it.
I think I would enjoy the game more if I could read the instructions rather than trying to guess by trial and error.

Overall I think this game is great. It’s aesthetically pleasing with a creative concept, and is very addictive! However, the tournament option is quite glitchy. I’ve played a couple games in this mode, but now I can’t access it and get one of a number of alerts about it either syncing, or being logged out of GameCenter (I’m not, I’ve checked).

I would also love a better explanation of the features that will be unlocked in the paid version before I actually pay for it.

The new update has changed the game so that the phone vibrates whenever you choose a card or score a hand. It’s really annoying. 
Click
Click
Buzz
Click
Click 
Click
Buzz
Make it stop.
Fun game play but Vegas Mode is laughably, frustratingly impossible. The regular mode is also a bit more difficult than I would like but still playable. Vegas Mode is not playable.

I had this on my phone a couple years ago, and then deleted it. I recently reinstalled the game, and remembered why I deleted it: it is so addictive. I can sit down and spend hours going “just one more game, just one more game.” If anything, I have learned that I am glad I don’t gamble. There are some things I find frustrating (like trashing a card and finding the SAME ONE underneath) but I think that’s mostly because I’m not very good at the game. If you like solitaire, or just think it’s ok, definitely play this version.

Great time killer but sometimes the rules make progress impossible.  Worse is the Vegas mode where you only get a payout if you have a card from the starred suit in the mix.  Had a straight flush worth nothing because it was the wrong suit.  Makes no sense.  Better to give an extra bonus if using a started suit, but not to penalize players for not having one in a hand.
There are times when the score does not show points I just played.

The Vegas mode is a total tome sink for me. (“Just one more game and I’m sure I’ll win!”) (why I do not gamble irl) the game itself is perfect, imo. I haven’t figured out why my iPad and iPhone don’t see each other’s scores, even though I’m logged into Game Center with the same user name on both. And I haven’t quite figured out the ranking and messages on the instant tournaments. But I absolutely love this game.

This is a fun solitaire game but with the last update it plays long ads with sounds... Even when I have my phone on mute. Cannot play when I'm in a quiet place because I never know when it's going to blast out sound. I understand getting ads but don't force me to have sound blasting out from long advertisments. I'm looking for a new game :(

The game is riddled with long, loud ads. I like to listen to things while I play games, but the amount of ads make this impossible. The amount of ads make it impossible to really get a feel for the game to judge if I want to pay to remove them. I won’t pay to remove them if I don’t care for the game. Scummy tactics by another clueless dev.

title.label: Too many adds since latest update

content.label: Long, annoying adds waaaayyyy too often now since the latest update. I understand with new features comes the need for more adds but I would rather the old game back and have less adds. Deleting this app :/

I have loved playing this game for a long time, especially double deck.  Unfortunately the update automatically installed on my phone and I believe it may have caused some issues with my phone’s cellular function, with a screen stuck on verifying cellular updates and no ability to call or text—scary.  I don’t care about my ranking with the rest of the world, but would like to be able to play my personal best without so much tracking and sucking down battery life & memory with statistics.  Is there a way to get back to the original version? It would be great to have a double deck version with the stepped up scoring used in tournament(otherwise it is all over too soon!) with the ability to opt out of worldwide rankings. Enid Adams
Best grocery line game ever!
Great game, but given how hard the Vegas option is, there really should be a reset feature so you can get back to zero. Couldn’t be hard to program this logic...

Why isn’t 2, A, J, Q K all spades only a straight and not a straight flush. I was so excited once I got it but all my hope were extinguished when it didn’t do this. Q, K, A is a 3 straight, so I am confused why this wasn’t coded in. Please add it in the next update so no more people have to suffer.
quality, elegant excellence. Sage Solitaire is ingenious and addictive.

I am loving the new Instant Tournament feature!  It gave this game a whole new life to me.

The only nitpicky thing I’d say is to have older instant tourney results fall off the list at some point.

Thanks for all of the work!

The 2.0 update with newer device support is very much appreciated! I’m excited to be able to play this game again with it taking full advantage of the new screen sizes!

One other feature I’d like to see added: darker colored backgrounds for day mode and/or the ability to switch the card front color separately from day/night mode.

The night mode feature is super useful, and I love the dark backgrounds it includes, but I prefer the white card front color for my normal game play. Given the OLED display of the newer iPhones, I know the darker backgrounds of night mode are also better for battery life so I’d love to be able to compromise a little and have a darker background with the white card front, whether that be by adding darker backgrounds to day mode or by allowing the card front color to change separately. Perhaps it could even be implemented so that all backgrounds are available regardless of the day/night mode, a switch exists for the card front, but the night mode switch remains available too. That way, users can customize their main game day mode however they want with any combo of dark/light background and black/white card front, while still having the convenience of the night mode switch to instantly get the dark on dark combo when desired!

title.label: great game, doesn’t support iphone X

content.label: please add support for iphone X / XR screen size! great game.

Omg I was looking for a cards game because I love cards, and this game showed up and I played and I love it!!!!!!! This game is awesome, it gives you free hints and everything!!! Download this game!! Brilliant job Zach!! Please make more games like this!
Vegas mode needs an Easy setting or something. It’s frustrating to never have a positive score. I reset it and 10 minutes later I’m in the red again. The scoring system is ... not fun.
This was an enjoyable game until you started with all of the pop up ads.

A good challenge; my pet peeve is the frequency of a duplicate card value right under a trashed card. In the real world, this would be much, much less frequent. Just seems not to be a random occurrence.
Ok if you don’t enjoying playing to win. It never happens!

title.label: I would really love iPhone X support.

content.label: See title. Great game but missing iPhone X resolution support.

I love the graphics, the concept, the ui, the whole package - except I can’t ever win! Now I don’t expect a namby-pamby gaming experience, that feeds me the false wins and warm fuzzies, but I mean that I have NEVER cleared the deck... and that’s just frustrating. I’m not like others that accuse Zach of maliciously stacking or leveling the deck with this intent, but I’m wondering if a tweek is in order for us mortal players?
Thanks so much for all your contributions to the gaming world, man!

2 minutes in = “I don’t think I like this one too much.”
2 hours later = “I /need/ to stop playing this!”
So much fun!!

title.label: The best game for a quick session

content.label: Even after a couple years this remains my go-to game for a short round in line or waiting for the train. I’m not a huge poker player — I’m not even good at it — but there’s something so satisfying about this formula.

If you like spending more time watching ads than actually playing a game, this game is for you. The ads are seriously exhausting. I get it, ad revenue blah blah blah. But seriously? 30 second ads after EVERY deal? Sometimes two ads in a row? 

Here's a tip: Ad overload makes games unenjoyable. People are more likely to pay for a full version of a fun game than to simply remove annoying ads. Your ads literally destroy this game. Not to mention the impossible deals and unbalanced scoring. 

There are other "less pretty" solitaire games out there that don't drown you with ads. I'll go with one of those instead.

After playing the game and purchasing it, I noticed that usually when I trash a card it's replaced by another one of the same value! How can this possibly be random? So I read the reviews. I'm not the first one to comment on this. I'll be deleting the game.

I love this game.
There is no other like it in the App Store. I finally unlocked True Grit mode. I had my phone in my hand as I went to stop my 2 year old from getting into something (as usual) and apparently my screen was unlocked so my hand must have hit true grit mode a few times because when I actually opened the app to play true grit mode I was negative and you can't reset it. I paid the $2.99 to unlock all modes...I think that should be included. Since you're still making new and updating your other apps...would you PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PRETTY PLEASE UPDATE SAGE SOLITARE!!!??!!!!
I enjoy this game a lot.

title.label: Vegas is rigged. So is the game.

content.label: Ive played over 100 games of this and it has serious problems. First off the game is $3 to buy, which is $3 too much. Secondly, no matter how hard you try, you will lose 75-90% of all games you play solely because you cannot make matches within the same row! (Not even 3 of a kind) 3rd is how vegas is impossible to beat because of win percentages and stack percentages. At this point, YOU should be paying US to even play this. Also if playing free and you don't like vegas, delete this game. True grit mode is vegas you just can't reset your bank.

It's a fun game, but I call complete BS that 2 people have over 100,000 points as a high score in single deck mode. It's not mathematically possible nor would the game let you even receive card combinations to even reach those heights even remotely. Its just bothersome. Even if somehow you could get 300 points a turn. You would need 333 turns to even reach 100,000 points. So its apparent that there are flaws in the math of this game and the card distribution at times.
Love this game but I wish I could play Vegas mode with both double deck and fifteen deck

Don't expect the perfect game. The standard game is pretty solid, but the flaws become glaringly obvious in vegas mode. The scoring system is fine, no where near perfect, in standard mode but extremely lacking when tweaked for vegas mode. The amount that a stack clear is worth is undervalued, which makes it vital to clear the table. That, in and of itself isn't awful. The tremendous flaw is when you combine the problem with stack values with the fact that combinations only add to your dollar amount if the bonus suit is included. 

I would love to be able to speak with the creators to come up with a good solution that maintains the right amount of difficulty.

I dont know whether the game is just extremely difficult or i'm just really dumb because i've played about 100 games in the free version and i haven't won once. Not winning makes a game really old, really fast
I get an error every time I try to purchase it and the ads are terrible.

My two stars is for the month that I enjoyed playing. Much like recent reviews, it has potential that grabs you at first but as you play, the flaws come out. Maybe it's the AI randomization that bothers me the most. It doesn't seem random... I've never gotten more pairs in a card game than in this game. Unfortunately, it doesn't count pairs as a thing. If I trash a card, more times than not, it's usually replaced with the exact same card... what? I thought it was just me but when a reviewer mentioned it I thought I should mention it too. I play it once in awhile, but then stop once it becomes annoying. Meh!
Very hard to win
Vegas game type doesn't correctly pay for flushes and others. Please fix. There is no game support that I can see on website.
